definition: to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Fireworks welcomed the new year in moscow's red square.
sentences.chinese: 人们在莫斯科红场燃放烟花庆祝新年。

sentences.english: Position the hose at a downspout drain to discharge then let go of the crimp.
sentences.chinese: 位置处于降排水软管燃放然后放过了卷曲。

sentences.english: Safety glasses should be worn when setting off fireworks and sparklers.
sentences.chinese: 应戴安全眼镜时燃放烟花爆竹和烟花。

sentences.english: We also get to set off fireworks.
sentences.chinese: 我们还要向套燃放烟花。

sentences.english: Free libations , holiday revelers, and of course, fireworks abound.
sentences.chinese: 免费的酒水，节日狂欢者，当然还有礼花燃放。

sentences.english: Others consider it harmful to set off fireworks.
sentences.chinese: 也有人认为它有害于燃放烟花。

sentences.english: Setting off fireworks has its advantages and disadvantages, so we should set off fire-works limitedly.
sentences.chinese: 燃放烟花爆竹有利有弊，所以我们应该有所限制。

sentences.english: We also enjoy making loud noise with firecrackers!
sentences.chinese: 我们也喜欢伴随著吵杂的声音燃放鞭炮。

sentences.english: During the Lantern Festival, people hang up colourful lanterns in their courtyards, play Yangko and set off fireworks.
sentences.chinese: 灯节时，人们在庭院里悬挂彩灯，扭秧歌并燃放烟花。

sentences.english: A man's heart is a firework that once in its time flashes heavenward.
sentences.chinese: 人的心是烟花，只能向天空燃放一次。

sentences.english: The teenagers like to let off firecrackers.
Please join us to light off firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 让我们一起燃放爆竹除旧岁。

sentences.english: In 7, the fire prevention, is strictly prohibited in the forest fire and fireworks.
sentences.chinese: 预防火灾，严禁在林区用火和燃放烟花爆竹。

sentences.english: Now it is not allowed to set off firecrackers in big cities on festivals.
sentences.chinese: 现在大城市在节假日里不允许燃放鞭炮。

sentences.english: Preliminary investigation indicated the fire was caused by firecrackers or Kongming Lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 初步分析认定失火系燃放烟花爆竹或放孔明灯所致。

definition: sky lantern (miniature hot-air balloon used during festivals)
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw
to clear waste land or forest by burning/slash-and-burn (agriculture)
to smoke/to cure over a fire
colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
